resource.name: Personal Income Tax Statistics By Zip Code
resource.description: This dataset contains data from California resident tax returns filed with California adjusted gross income and self-assessed tax listed by zip code.  This dataset contains data for taxable years 1992 to the most recent tax year available.

resource.description: This dataset contains personal income tax statistics for taxpayers by the county of residence based on tax returns. Population data comes from the Department of Finance Exhibits.

resource.name: C-7A And C-7B, Corporation Tax Credits Allowed By Corporation Type
resource.description: This dataset contains corporate tax statistics for C and S corporations based on corporate tax returns.
columns_description: Special Tax Credit Name.
The amount of the Special Tax Credit allowed divided by the total amount of all Special Tax Credits allowed.
Identifies C and S corporations.
A "Y" denotes the credit has expired. Amounts for expired credits result from carryover provisions. A "N" denotes the credit has not expired.
Taxable year for which tax returns were filed in a number format that can be used to filter and sort, as well as display in charts.
Number of Returns With Special Credit.
Amount of special credits allowed.

resource.name: B-3, Adjusted Gross Income with Accumulated Percentages
resource.description: This dataset includes adjusted gross income, taxable income, and total tax liability personal income tax Statistics for California resident tax returns by taxable year.
columns_description: California taxable income amount of each AGIC range.
Percent	Cumulative percentage of the taxable liability amount within each AGIC range out of the total taxable liability amount of all AGIC ranges.
Percentage of the taxable liability amount within each AGIC range out of the total taxable liability amount of all AGIC ranges.
Taxable liability amount of each AGIC range.
Percentage of the taxable income amount within each AGIC range out of the total taxable income amount of all AGI class ranges.
Total California Adjusted Gross Income (AGIC) before California deductions.
Number of returns filed.
Percentage of the adjusted gross income (AGI) amount out of the total adjusted gross income.
Cumulative percentage of the number of returns within each AGIC out of the total number of returns.
Percentage of the number of returns within each AGIC out of the total number of returns.
Adjusted Gross Income Category (AGIC) is the category of taxpayers whose income falls within a specified adjusted gross income range.
Taxable year for which tax returns were filed in a number format that can be used for display in charts.
Cumulative percentage of the taxable income amount within each AGIC range out of the total taxable income amount of all AGIC ranges.
Cumulative percentage of the percent of adjusted gross income.
